results.title: Jindabyne
results.creator_credit: Ray Lawrence, Catherine Jarmar and April Films
results.brief_description: Based on the Raymond Carver short story “So much water so close to home”, this is a compelling drama about a marriage drawn asunder by a young girl’s murder. Stewart Kane, played by Irish actor Gabrielle Byrne, goes fishing with friends to a remote spot; when he and his friends find a young girl’s mutilated body they continue with their trip, reporting the crime upon their return. Such callousness makes Claire (Laura Linney) question her marriage and her husband’s humanity and she is drawn into a web of intrigue and ethical dilemmas. Expanding upon Carver’s original text, Lawrence examines Aboriginal rites and ceremonies and places, central to the narrative, the uncomfortable relationship between the black and white communities.

constellations_other.name: The ‘Australian' alps
constellations_other.description: These feature films and documentaries show how stories have been told to lay claim - and reclaim - the land and our national identity.

results.title: The Life story of John Lee, or, The Man they could not hang
results.creator_credit: Arthur W Sterry, Frederich Haldane and Sterry and Haldane
results.brief_description: This story is about an Englishman, John Lee, who in 1885 escaped the gallows after being convicted of murder, because three times the trapdoor failed to work. After many years in prison a dying woman’s confession finally clears Lee of the murder. Although supposedly based on fact it seems likely that the silent film versions were based on a play performed in Australia in 1912. The success of the first film version (now lost) made in the same year led the distributors Haldane and Sherry to produce a new version in 1921 expanding the story to include scenes from Lee’s happy childhood. Piety and intensity of emotion are emphasised and the film is at times crudely sentimental. Despite negative reviews the remake was again very successful with the public. Raymond Longford remade the story as a talkie in 1934; this third version has also been lost. Cast includes Rose Rooney, David Edelsten Cinematography by Tasman G. Higgins. Silent film with intertitles.

results.title: Greenhide
results.creator_credit: Charles Chauvel and Australian Film Productions
results.brief_description: Out of boredom, a high society girl visits her father’s outback cattle station. After several adventures involving a gang of ruthless cattle duffers, she falls in love with the manager of the station. Cast includes Elsie Sylvaney, Bruce Gordon, Jules Murray-Prior, Irma Deardon, Frank thorn, alfred Greenup, Gerald Barlow. Silent film with intertitles.

results.title: The Romantic story of Margaret Catchpole
results.brief_description: A melodrama about a young girl sentenced to transportation to New South Wales for stealing a horse to save her lover from the excise men. Cast includes Lottie Lyell, Raymond Longford, Augustus Neville, Sybil Wilde.

results.title: The Passion of Joan of Arc = The Passion of Jeanne D'Arc
results.creator_credit: Carl Theodor Dreyer and Societe Generale Des Films
results.brief_description: The script was based on original transcripts of the trial of Jeanne d’Arc, period detail was carefully researched, unusually solid sets were constructed and a monumental performance given by Falconetti as Jeanne. However, it is the films formal rigour which places it in the forefront of experimental film art. Cast includes Renee Falconetti, Antonin Artaud, Michel Simon.

results.title: Metro
results.creator_credit: Thomas Carter, Randy Fedlman, Ray Murray Jr and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: Eddie Murphy utilises his manic comic skills as a hostage negotiator working for the San Francisco Police Department. His cool-under-fire demeanour is tested when his girlfriend is taken hostage by a man who was also responsible for the death of a friend and colleague. Starring Eddie Murphy, Michael Rapaport, and Michael Wincott.

results.title: The Rock
results.creator_credit: Michael Bay, Jerry Bruckheimer, Don Simpson, Don Simpson/Jerry Bruckheimer Films and Hollywood Pictures
results.brief_description: Action thriller set on the island of Alcatraz where 81 tourist hostages are being held by a somewhat unstable Marine Corps general called Francis X. Hummel (Ed Harris). The ransom is $100 million for war reparations to the families of servicemen killed in covert operations and if this is not paid then Hummel and his men will bomb San Francisco with deadly gas. Enter FBI chemical weapons expert Stanley Goodspeed (Nicolas Cage) and former British spy Jack Patrick Mason (Sean Connery) whose assignment is to penetrate Alcatraz and stop Hummel at all cost. Fast-paced and frenetic.

results.title: G.I. Jane
results.creator_credit: Ridley Scott, Suzanne Todd, Demi Moore, Roger Birnbaum and Hollywood Pictures
results.brief_description: Addressing the issue of whether women belong on the battlefield, Ridley Scott’s “G. I. Jane” stars a seriously buffed Demi Moore in the title role as an ambitious Lieutenant, keen to make it as a navy SEAL. Pitted against a ruthless commander (a pre-“Lord of the Rings” Viggo Mortensen) Jordan’s quest is damned by the corrupt presence of a female Senator, who must stage-manage the recruit’s failure for political gain. A fantastic premise is at times left aside for detailing of military training sequences that involve your standard “spit in your face and kick you when you are down” routines. Cast also includes Anne Bancroft, Jason Beghe.

results.title: Instinct
results.creator_credit: Jon Turteltaub, Christina Steinberg, Brian Doubleday, Richard Lerner, Michael Taylor, Barbara Boyle and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: This psychological thriller is about an anthropologist, Ethan Powell, who leaves human society to live among gorillas. Fully ensconced in this animal world, Powell is extradited back to the United States after murdering two gorilla poachers. Once there, it falls to an ambitious psychiatrist to discover the non-communicative Powell’s secrets. With in-form performances by Anthony Hopkins and Cuba Gooding Jr, this film attempts with profundity to address human nature, harmony with the natural world, and what motivates passions bordering on insanity. Cast also includes Donald Sutherland.

results.title: Hot lead and cold feet
results.creator_credit: Robert Butler, Ron Miller and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: A Walt Disney comedy about a pioneer who has founded the small town of Bloodshy. With the assistance of his twin sons, Eli discovers he must fight for control of the town’s future against the town’s corrupt mayor. With Jim Dale playing the three main roles this is essentially a family oriented adventure film set in the old Wild West, replete with gunslingers and outlaws. Cast also includes Karen Valentine, Don Knotts, Jack Elam and John Williams.
